definition: abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: Here, the Asia Water Project summarises the arguments.
sentences.chinese: 以下是亚洲水资源项目对该论题的概述。
论题或者局域学习小组。

sentences.english: This is the most problematic part of his thesis.
sentences.chinese: 这是他论题中最有争议的部分。

sentences.english: Use your own content to sing the praises of others in your topic.
sentences.chinese: 在你的论题中用自己的内容来歌颂他人。

sentences.english: The origin of the universe is an ageless topic.
sentences.chinese: 关于宇宙的起源的问题是个永恒的论题。

sentences.english: In chapter two, how Russell proved his topic of mathematics logicism is introduced in detail.
sentences.chinese: 第二章详细介绍了罗素对其数学逻辑主义论题的证明。

sentences.english: Square topic based on the "not forget the old Japan, but also to pay attention to the new Japan."
sentences.chinese: 正方的论题基于“不忘旧日本，更要关注新日本”。

sentences.english: It's practically impossible to write a good essay without a clear thesis.
sentences.chinese: 如果你没有清晰的论题，是不可能写出一篇好论文的。

sentences.english: What topics should be discussed at the club assembly?
sentences.chinese: 社务行政会议应讨论什么论题？

sentences.english: The calculation of eigenvalue problem is one of the basic topics of scientific computing.
sentences.chinese: 特征值问题的计算方法是科学计算基本论题之一。

sentences.english: Fifth, it is designed to discuss some open questions.
sentences.chinese: 五是设计了一些开放型讨论题。

sentences.english: He squeezed 10 pages out of a small subject.
sentences.chinese: 他就一个小论题硬写出10页文章来。

sentences.english: He now has an indepth knowledge of digital nail art machines .
sentences.chinese: 他现在拥有的知识就论题数码艺术指甲机器。

sentences.english: In introduction, the author puts forward the reason of the topic and the topical contents.
sentences.chinese: 引言部分，提出论文选题的缘起与论题大旨。

sentences.english: Formal disputation of such an issue.
sentences.chinese: 关于这种论题的正式辩论。

sentences.english: The foreword generally describes Jameson's academic career and then draws main part.
sentences.chinese: “前言”概述杰姆逊的学术生涯，并引出本文论题。

definition: proposition (logic, math.)/to assign an essay topic
(of a body of people) to offer all kinds of different opinions (idiom)/to argue endlessly
epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
to prove a point/to expound on/to demonstrate or prove (through argument)/proof
circular argument/logical error consisting of begging the question/Latin: petitio principii
